infoparam.name: UML Note
infoparam.value: Versioning Version 1: nominal behavior in a perfect environment. Version 2: memory overflow.

Line.value: Version 1: nominal behavior
in a perfect environment.
Version 2: memory overflow.

infoparam.name: UML Note
infoparam.value: Author: Pierre de Saqui-Sannes Company: ISAE Date: July 3, 2013.

Line.value: Author: Pierre de Saqui-Sannes
Company: ISAE
Date: July 3, 2013.

infoparam.name: UML Note
infoparam.value:
System --------- The drone is fully auto-piloted: if we give it some correct GPS coordinates, it will fly by itself to this coordinate in an unknown but non-infinite duration.
The duration it takes to go to the GPS coordinates is supposed to be the distance divided by 10.
The drone stays at the same GPS position until it is ordered to move.

Line.value: The drone is fully auto-piloted: if we give it
some correct GPS coordinates, it will fly
by itself to this coordinate in an unknown but
non-infinite duration.
The duration it takes to go to the GPS coordinates
is supposed to be the distance divided by 10.
The drone stays at the same GPS position until
it is ordered to move.

infoparam.name: UML Note
infoparam.value:
Environment ----------------
Availability -------------- Somebody is available to send orders to the UAV.
System-Environment Communication --------------------------------------------- A command from the operator is immediately received by the UAV.
The communication link beetween the UAV and the ground is fully reliable.

Line.value: Somebody is available to send orders to the UAV.
System-Environment Communication
A command from the operator is immediately
received by the UAV.
The communication link beetween the UAV
and the ground is fully reliable.

infoparam.name: UML Note
infoparam.value:
Model analysis ------------------
The simulation and verification facilities offered by TTool will be used to check the design diagrams of the UAV model againt the following properties.
Property 1. Each time the ground pilot sends a "take a picture order to the UAV the lattter eventually takes the picture and stores it on the flash memory".
Property 2. "If the ground pilot asks for landing the drone, then the drone lands successfully."

Line.value: Model analysis
The simulation and verification facilities offered by TTool
will be used to check the design diagrams of the UAV model
againt the following properties.
Property 1. Each time the ground pilot sends a "take a picture
order to the UAV the lattter eventually takes the picture
and stores it on the flash memory".
Property 2. "If the ground pilot asks for landing the drone,
then the drone lands successfully."

infoparam.name: UML Note
infoparam.value:
Error codes --------------
Would an error occur, the DroneController has an errno field, which contains the type of error. errno=0 : no error errno=1 : memory full errno=2 : fatal camera error errno=3 : navigation error errno=4 : fuel error

Line.value: Error codes
Would an error occur, the DroneController has an
errno field, which contains the type of error.
errno=0 : no error
errno=1 : memory full
errno=2 : fatal camera error
errno=3 : navigation error
errno=4 : fuel error

textline.data: at a defined positon and make
The drone shall inform the ground
when the picture has been stored
The drone shall embedd an HD camera
The drone shall process a command
containing the order to land at a GPS
The drone shall be able to transfer
images stored when it has landed.
The drone shall go by itself

infoparam.name: connector from Use case to actor
UML Note
infoparam.value:
Complete this diagram with other actors and use cases. In particular, what is related to drone movements is not given in this first draft.
Then, make scenarios for use cases
